meanings.definition: Differing in form or structure from the usual type
meanings.sent1: The artist created a heteromorphic sculpture that amazed everyone with its unique shape.
meanings.sent2: The flowers in the garden were heteromorphic, ranging from round to star-shaped.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked so heteromorphic that it seemed to be from another planet!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a heteromorphic puzzle, each one fitting together in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The clouds in the sky formed a heteromorphic pattern, like a painting come to life.

meanings.definition: Exhibiting diversity in shape or structure
meanings.sent1: The forest was filled with heteromorphic trees, some tall and thin, others short and wide.
meanings.sent2: The rocks on the beach were heteromorphic, with smooth pebbles next to jagged stones.
meanings.sent3: The classroom had a heteromorphic mix of desks, some round and others rectangular.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like a heteromorphic kaleidoscope, constantly shifting and changing.
meanings.sent5: The city skyline was a heteromorphic silhouette against the setting sun, each building unique in shape.
